#Text=Makrinitsa
#Text=Makrinitsa ( Greek : Μακρινίτσα ) , called the ' balcony ' of Mt .
#Text=Pelion , Magnesia , Greece , for it 's amazing views .
#Text=Located only birth-flight , or by winding mountain road , north-east of Volos it is one of the most easily accessed of Pelions 24 villages .
#Text=Understand
#Text=One of the most characteristic traditional settlements on mount Pelion .
#Text=It is filled with mansions and houses from the Ottoman era that look like hanging ornaments on the green mountain side and are colorful ( but not as Portaria ) .
#Text=Many of these have been restored into restaurants and guesthouses .
#Text=It sits on a slope of the Pelion range and another mountaintop to the east with forests , at a height of about above sea level .
#Text=The square with age-old trees lends a panoramic view of Volos and the Pagasetic Gulf .
#Text=In one of the traditional coffee houses there is a big fresco by the 20th century naïve folkloristic artist Theofilos .
#Text=The picturesque cobbled paths of Makrinitsa are scattered with traditional water fountains .
#Text=Makrynitsa , with a population of about 900 people , has a school , a lyceum , a church , a post office and a square ( plateia ) with tall trees .
#Text=Orientation in Makrinitsa is made more difficult by the fact that village streets are not named .
#Text=Every place has got the address " Makrinitsa 370 11 " .
#Text=Fortunately Makrinitsa is not very large , and you can easily orient yourself by the pedestrian main street , on which you will find the town square and the village church .
#Text=Get in
#Text=By bus from Volos Interurban Bus Terminal ( " Yperastiko KTEL " ) ( KTEL Volou ) , Details on buses , can be found online here
#Text=A taxi from Volos city centre will cost approximately € 20 , although do ask before you get in .
#Text=There is some parking in the village , in the main carpark at the foot of the village and on the approach roads .
#Text=It does get very busy in the carpark , and the approach roads are on a fairly steep gradient .
#Text=Park with your front wheels turned to point into the kerb and either in park or in first gear !
#Text=Do
#Text=Pelion Museum of Folklore and History ( Signposted from the main square . ) .
#Text=Saturday 11:00 - 14:30 , Sunday 11:00 - 14:30 .
#Text=Adults € 2 , children free , groups € 1 pp.
#Text=Buy
#Text=There is a main street lined with shops leading from the carpark to the main square .
#Text=These shops sell all kinds of touristy trinkets , as well as jarred fruits in syrup , local herbs and pasta .
#Text=Eat
#Text=To Kentrikon ( Κέντρικο ) , Main square .
#Text=Good food , much of which is from local recipes .
#Text=The highlight is the fantastic view from the tables on the square .
#Text=7-9€ for a large dish .
#Text=Cardamom Oinomageireio ( Καρδαμο Οινομαγειρειον ) , ☏ +302428090131 .
#Text=A cosy restaurant with a large outdoors seating area .
#Text=Drink
#Text=The tap water is drinkable and restaurants will serve glasses of ice water upon request .
#Text=Local drinks include Mythos ( beer ) and Ouzo .
#Text=A café and bar .
#Text=As anywhere else in Makrinitsa , it has a large outdoor seating which offer a great view of Volos .
#Text=Indoors you will find a welcoming fire and a large number of paintings by local artists .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Archontika Karamarlis Boutique Hotel & Guesthouse ( Has got a main entrance towards the car road climbing mount Pelion and a back-entrance towards the village main street ) , ☏ +302428099570 .
#Text=An old mansion turned hotel with a breakfast buffet and a great view of Volos .
#Text=They often host larger celebrations such as weddings .
